page.title: 13BRANT BROUGHTON BUILDINGS
page.content: There are several interesting buildings in Brant Broughton: The present Manor House,dated 1766 is thought to be part of a barn belonging to the original house.The picturesque almshouses,built in 1860, were intended for poor widows,but this restriction has since been lifted. There is a tradition that Joseph Lister once stayed at Lister Place.The stone-built Priory is the oldest house in the village dating from 1658. There are many imposing buildings along High Street.Grey Garth was the agent's house for the Sutton Estate. Brant House is surrounded by wrought iron work made at the nearby forge, which still operates.The Old House was formerly a doctor's surgery and a butcher's.The Old Hall,now a vet's was once occupied by the Revd.Swan who added the top floor to house pupils.
